title: ‘Classic case of blind faith’: HC jails man for killing wife; nixes his 1984 acquittal
content: After a 43-year legal battle, the Allahabad High Court convicted an elderly man and an accomplice for strangling his wife in 1982. Overturning a 1984 acquittal, Awadhesh Kumar and Mata Prasad received life imprisonment for murder, masked as a ghost exorcism. The court condemned this shocking case of blind faith, also imposing fines and three-year sentences for destroying evidence.

title: Sangh centenary: PM underlines RSS fight against caste bias; flags illegal immigration
content: PM Modi lauded the RSS's continuous fight against caste discrimination and untouchability, citing its chiefs' calls for shared public spaces. He defended the Sangh against 'Brahmanical outfit' claims and highlighted its historical involvement in the freedom struggle and post-independence movements. Modi also reiterated his strong warning about illegal immigration posing a significant threat to India's demography and internal security.

title: Assam: Govt okays widening of section of NH-715 to 4 lanes; to cost Rs 6.9K cr
content: The Cabinet approved a Rs 6,957 crore project to widen and improve the 86-km Kalibor-Numaligarh section of NH-715 in Assam, including 34.5 km of elevated sections through Kaziranga National Park. This initiative aims to eliminate human-animal conflict by abandoning the existing highway, allowing unhindered animal movement and boosting tourism while ensuring wildlife safety.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; says X account won’t be updated until…
content: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years, as Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. This lapse halts "non-essential" functions like visa services and national parks, while essential employees work without pay. The US Embassy in India also announced reduced updates to its X account.

title: Sangh @100: RSS custodian of India’s civilisational philosophy, says Hosabale
content: RSS leaders celebrated the government's release of a commemorative stamp and coin, marking the Sangh's century-long journey and its recognition as a mainstream force. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh highlighted RSS's role in communal harmony, citing its assistance during the 1984 anti-Sikh riots and its respectful relationship with Mahatma Gandhi despite differences.

title: UP: IIT-K student found dead in hostel; absence noticed after foul smell
content: A 22-year-old IIT-Kanpur electrical engineering student, Dheeraj Saini, was found dead in his hostel room on Wednesday after not being seen since Sunday. Police, alerted by a foul smell, suspect depression as the cause, though no suicide note was found. Authorities are investigating, seizing his personal items, while his family stated they were unaware of any problems.

title: UP: 6 dead as ‘mentally unstable’ farmer kills 2 boys; sets self, family on fire
content: A chilling incident in Bahraich left six charred bodies, including two children, discovered in a house. Farmer Vijay Maurya allegedly murdered two village boys before setting his wife, two young daughters, and himself ablaze inside their home. Police suspect mental instability, citing an infant son's recent death and family disputes.

title: Bill Gates’ personality shift: How his daughter helped; forced him to talk to people
content: Phoebe Gates, Bill Gates' youngest daughter, revealed how she actively helped her shy father overcome his awkwardness from a young age. She recounted pushing him to socialize at events, even father-daughter dances. Phoebe also shared their intense competitive streak, particularly when she introduces new boyfriends, and how she navigates being recognized as "Bill's daughter" by embracing her own identity.

title: Rajasthan: Drug blamed for 2021 Delhi deaths claims life of 5-year-old; probe sought
content: Rajasthan faces scrutiny after a five-year-old died in Sikar from a dextromethorphan-based cough syrup, a drug linked to 2021 Delhi deaths. Despite Delhi's ban for young children, Rajasthan prescribed it under a free scheme. Officials are probing, but activists demand an independent inquiry into the widely distributed medicine, raising serious questions about public health oversight.

title: RSS@100: CJI’s mom to skip Sangh function; flags remarks against husband
content: CJI Bhushan Gavai's mother, Kamaltai Gavai, confirmed she will not attend the Sangh's centenary event on October 5, citing health issues. Amid social media buzz regarding her supposed acceptance, Gavai clarified her steadfast dedication to Ambedkarite ideology. She highlighted her late husband's practice of attending such events to advocate Ambedkar's views, while never embracing Hindutva.

title: Aishwarya, Abhishek vs Google: Bachchans take YouTube to court; AI threat
content: Bollywood stars Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan sued YouTube over AI-generated deepfakes misusing their personas. They demand content removal and safeguards to prevent their likeness from training AI models without consent, citing concerns about misleading information. This landmark case in India seeks $450,000 in damages and a permanent injunction.

title: Punjab: 5 die of drug overdose in 3 days; state tops NCRB list
content: A drug overdose crisis has gripped Ferozepur, where four young men died within two days, pushing Punjab's weekly toll to five. The state led India in drug fatalities last year. Grieving families and furious villagers blocked a highway, alleging police inaction and doorstep drug delivery, intensifying calls for urgent government intervention against the rampant addiction.

title: Chidambaram’s 26/11 remark will only help BJP, says Cong’s Alvi; questions timing
content: Congress leader Rashid Alvi questioned P Chidambaram's statement. Chidambaram claimed foreign pressure restrained the Manmohan Singh government after 26/11. Alvi asked why this claim surfaced after sixteen years. He suggested it implied US pressure on the UPA government. Alvi stated such remarks only benefit the BJP. The BJP launched an attack on Congress following Chidambaram's comments.

title: Bhopal: Fearing job loss over 2-kid policy, MP couple dump newborn; duo booked
content: A government teacher and his wife in Madhya Pradesh allegedly buried their newborn son alive, fearing job loss under the state's two-child policy. The couple, already having three children, abandoned their fourth child in a forest. Miraculously, villagers rescued the three-day-old boy after hearing cries. The couple now faces attempt-to-murder charges, highlighting MP's high infant abandonment rates.

title: Mumbai: Dog boards local train to escape firecracker; rescued after 17 days
content: A friendly dog named Nemo, startled by loud firecrackers, accidentally boarded a train at Churchgate and traveled to Kandivli. After 17 days of anxious searching by worried residents, she was finally located in the suburbs with the help of local feeders. Her safe return brought immense relief and happiness to her caregivers.

title: Saquon Barkley, Brandon Graham’s daughters quiz Eagles stars with questions
content: Eagles players DeVonta Smith, A.J. Brown, Dallas Goedert, Zach Baun, Lane Johnson, Saquon Barkley, and Reed Blankenship were hilariously interviewed by Saquon Barkley's and Brandon Graham's daughters. The girls asked tough questions, like who their favorite dad was and why some players were bald, leading to amusing responses and lighthearted banter among the team.

title: MPs Baijayant Panda & Tejasvi to head panels on IBC - full list
content: New parliamentary committee chairpersons have been announced. Baijayant Panda will lead the IBC Amendment Bill select committee. Tejasvi Surya heads the Jan Vishwas Bill select committee. The Lok Sabha Secretariat also released the updated list of 24 Parliamentary Standing Committees. Key leaders retain important roles. Nishikant Dubey continues with Communications and IT. Shashi Tharoor remains in External Affairs.

title: UN peacekeepers’ meet: India doesn’t invite Pak, China; reiterates troop policy
content: India is hosting a conclave for Army chiefs of UN troop-contributing nations, notably excluding Pakistan and China. Officials reiterated New Delhi's policy against deploying troops to foreign conflict zones like Ukraine or Gaza unless explicitly mandated by the UNSC and under the UN flag. India remains a major contributor to UN peacekeeping missions globally.

title: Legal paradox: Man gets relief in fake currency case in Mumbai; life sentence in UP
content: A Mumbai court discharged a man in a fake currency case. He was already convicted and sentenced to life imprisonment for the same offense in Lucknow. The judge cited double jeopardy, barring a second trial. Girjesh Yadav's seven-year Mumbai trial concluded. He will now return to Lucknow to serve his remaining sentence for manufacturing and circulating fake notes.

title: 'Threats of false cases': Ex-AAP worker accuses Punjab minister of sexual harassment
content: A former AAP women's wing functionary filed a sexual harassment complaint against Punjab health minister Dr Balbir Singh in a Patiala court, accusing him of repeated harassment, molestation, and intimidation. She also named his son and others in a criminal conspiracy, alleging unwelcome advances and demanding arrests. Singh has denied the charges.

title: 'Tariffs to help farmers': Trump announces meeting with Xi; US soybeans in focus
content: Donald Trump announced plans to use tariff revenue to aid American soybean farmers, who are suffering because China has halted purchases for "negotiating" reasons. He criticized Joe Biden for not enforcing a trade agreement and vowed to address the issue with Xi Jinping, as China now buys from Brazil and Argentina.

title: Single adverse remark or doubtful integrity enough to retire judge: Gujarat HC
content: The Gujarat High Court ruled that a single adverse remark or doubtful integrity is sufficient for a judge's compulsory retirement, even without a show-cause notice. This decision, not considered punishment, upheld the retirement of J K Acharya and 17 other judges, emphasising the high ethical standards expected from judicial officers.

title: J&K: Searches in Kathua after suspicious border movements; footprint traced
content: Security forces launched extensive searches in Juthana Rajbagh, Kathua, following reports of three suspicious individuals, one with a heavy backpack. J&K police and BSF are combing the area along the Ujh river near the Pakistan border. Footprints confirm movement, though no suspects have been apprehended yet. This operation follows a fierce gunbattle in the same vicinity this March.

title: J&K: Govt teacher booked under POCSO Act in Rajouri; at large after suspension
content: A government school teacher in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district was suspended and booked under the POCSO Act on Tuesday for allegedly sexually assaulting a girl student. Students staged protests following the incident, which ceased after the teacher's suspension and an FIR. The accused, Ajaz Ahmad, is currently absconding, prompting a police manhunt. This grave allegation has sparked significant concern.

title: Ricky Hatton cause of death: How did the English boxing legend die at 46
content: Ricky "The Hitman" Hatton, a celebrated British boxer, has died at 46. Police discovered his body at his home in Hyde, Greater Manchester, confirming no suspicious circumstances. The news arrives shortly after Hatton announced a comeback fight in Dubai, leaving the boxing world in mourning for the beloved champion who battled both inside and outside the ring.

title: Emari Demercado to lead Cardinals? RB situation sparks TNF debate
content: Emari Demercado is set for a significantly larger role with the Arizona Cardinals starting Sunday, October 6, 2025, against the Titans. This comes after rookie Trey Benson was placed on injured reserve and James Conner is out for the season. Demercado and Michael Carter will now carry the backfield load, with Demercado handling more inside carries.

title: 'Haven't spoken to husband till now': Wangchuk's wife writes to Prez; makes urgent appeal
content: Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk's wife, Gitanjali Angmo, appealed to President Droupadi Murmu for her husband's unconditional release. Wangchuk was arrested under the National Security Act and moved to Jodhpur, accused of inciting violence during Ladakh protests demanding statehood and Sixth Schedule status. Angmo alleges a "witch hunt" against him for his advocacy.

title: Shocking! ILT20 2025 Auction: Ravichandran Ashwin goes unsold
content: Veteran Indian off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin, 38, surprisingly went unsold at the ILT20 2025 auction in Dubai, despite his USD 120,000 base price. His snub shocked many, given his stellar career and recent retirement from international and IPL cricket, which had made his availability a significant talking point. This unexpected turn of events has left many questioning the auction dynamics.

title: 'Ready to hand over Asia Cup trophy': Naqvi says 'never apologised' to BCCI
content: ACC President Mohsin Naqvi fiercely refuted claims of apologising to BCCI regarding the Asia Cup trophy, accusing Indian media of "fabricated propaganda." This controversy stems from India's refusal to accept the trophy from Naqvi after their victory, citing geopolitical tensions. Reports indicate Naqvi initially avoided acknowledging India's triumph, leaving the champions without their prize and escalating the cricket-politics dispute.

title: 'Deliberately starved' her to death: Indian-origin couple allegedly killed daughter in UK
content: An Indian-origin couple, Manpreet Jatana and Jaskiret Singh Uppal, are facing murder charges for allegedly deliberately starving their three-year-old daughter to death nearly two years ago. Police found the toddler's "emaciated" body in December 2023, with examinations confirming malnutrition and prolonged starvation as the cause. They remain in custody.

title: 'Any attack on Qatar ...': Trump warns Netanyahu; signs order after Israeli strike
content: US President Donald Trump signed an executive order guaranteeing Qatar's security, including potential military action if attacked. This action followed recent Israeli airstrikes on Qatar targeting Hamas leaders, which both Qatari and US officials condemned. The order declares an attack on Qatar a threat to US peace and security, raising questions given Israel's status as a US ally.

title: Fed board row: SC blocks Trump from firing Cook; hearing scheduled for Jan 2026
content: The Supreme Court blocked Donald Trump's immediate removal of Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, ensuring she remains until January 2026 arguments. Trump accused Cook of mortgage fraud, but lower courts ruled her dismissal violated "for cause" requirements. This rare challenge to Fed independence highlights a broader legal battle over presidential authority to fire officials.

title: Search op in J&K: Security forces deployed in Rajbagh sector; 3 suspects reported
content: Security forces launched a search operation in Kathua's Rajbagh sector after locals reported three suspicious individuals, one with a heavy backpack, near the International Border. The joint police and BSF team found footprints confirming movement along the Ujh river but made no arrests. This operation follows a similar recent search for alleged terror suspects in the district.

title: Happy Dussehra 2025: Top 50 Wishes, Messages, and Quotes to share with your loved ones
content: Dussehra, or Vijayadashami, is a vibrant Indian festival celebrating the triumph of good over evil, specifically Lord Rama's victory over Ravana. Observed on October 2, 2025, it features effigy burnings, fairs, and marks the end of Navratri. This festival promotes joy, new beginnings, and hope, reminding everyone that goodness always prevails.

title: G7 Nations Says They Will Target Those Increase Their Russian Oil Purchases
content: The Group of Seven nations' finance ministers said on Wednesday they will take joint steps to increase pressure on Russia by targeting those who are continuing to increase their purchases of Russian oil and those that are facilitating circumvention.

title: Rapper Who Joined Trump At Rally Jailed For 5 Years For Attempted Murder
content: A New York City rapper who joined President Donald Trump during a campaign rally last year has been sentenced to five years behind bars after he admitted he used earnings from his music career to fuel gang violence in Brooklyn.

title: Gaza Aid Flotilla Says Israeli Warships "Intercepted" Boats
content: Israeli naval forces on Wednesday intercepted a flotilla carrying aid to Gaza, ending its latest bid to break an Israeli blockade of the war-battered Palestinian territory.

title: Israel Issues "Last" Warning For Gazans To Flee As Hamas Weighs Up Ceasefire
content: Israel issued a final warning Wednesday for people to flee Gaza's main city, as Hamas weighed US President Donald Trump's plan to end nearly two years of war in the Palestinian territory.

title: Chief Justice BR Gavai's Mother Says She Won't Attend RSS Vijayadashami Event
content: Kamal Gavai, Chief Justice of India Bhushan Gavai's mother, on Wednesday said she would not attend a centenary program of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) here on October 5.

title: Hamas Pressed By Arab States To Accept Trump's Gaza Peace Plan
content: Arab and Muslim national leaders are pushing Hamas to accept the Gaza plan unveiled by US President Donald Trump this week, saying the need to end the fighting surpasses concern about the finer details.

title: Rajasthan Man Trying To Mediate Dispute Shot Dead, Case Filed
content: A 29-year-old man attempting to mediate an altercation between two groups was shot dead at Ramgarh village in Kota district, police said on Wednesday.

title: US Aerospace Delivers Another F-404 Engine For Tejas MK-1A Jets
content: American defence major GE Aerospace has handed over another jet engine to state-run aerospace major Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd (HAL) for its Tejas light combat aircraft programme, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Inside 'Alligator Alcatraz': Color-Coded Uniforms, 5.30 Am Breakfast, Strict Rules
content: Detainees arriving at the immigration detention centre in the Florida Everglades known as "Alligator Alcatraz" are given color-coded uniforms and wrist-bands and then segregated based on their criminal history and whether they're considered a flight.

title: Jane Goodall, Conservationist Renowned For Environmental Advocacy, Dies At 91
content: Jane Goodall, the conservationist renowned for her groundbreaking chimpanzee field research and globe-spanning environmental advocacy, has died.

title: Trump Holds Phone As Netanyahu Dials Qatar To Apologise For Attack
content: Whether Netanyahu delivered a scripted apology to Qatar is a speculation that erupted after the White House circulated a black-and-white photograph showing US President Donald Trump gripping the phone while Netanyahu appeared to read from a page.

title: Infant Dies After Falling Headfirst Into Water-Filled Bucket In DelhI
content: A one-year-old girl died after accidentally falling headfirst into a bucket filled with water at her home in Delhi's Budh Vihar, police said on Wednesday.

title: 'Zero-Tolerance Policy Towards Cheating, Use Of Fake Certificates': UPSC Chairman
content: UPSC Chairman Ajay Kumar on Wednesday said that cheating and use of fake certificates in any government job recruitment examination by the candidates is "unacceptable" and it can cause long-term career damage to them.

title: Rs 6 Lakh Gone In A Blink: On Camera, UP Woman Steals Gold Necklace
content: A gold necklace worth over Rs 6 lakh was stolen from a jewellery showroom in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr, with the entire incident caught on CCTV.

title: 17-Year-Old Girl Stabs Mother Over Mobile Phone Dispute In Kerala
content: A 17-year-old girl allegedly stabbed and seriously injured her mother following a dispute over mobile phone use in this coastal district, police said on Wednesday.

title: Air India Lauches Direct Flight To Philippines From Delhi
content: Air India on Wednesday launched its direct flights from the national capital to Manila, the capital city of the Philippines.

title: Neighbour Shoots Man With Air Gun In Delhi, Arrested
content: A 37-year-old man was injured after being shot at with an air gun allegedly by his neighbour in southwest Delhi's Sagarpur area on Wednesday, police said.

title: Rajesh Agrawal Takes Charge As Commerce Secretary
content: Senior IAS officer Rajesh Agrawal on Wednesday assumed charge as Secretary, Department of Commerce, an official statement said.

title: 'India's Trade Pact With European Countries Comes Into Force': Piyush Goyal
content: The free trade agreement between India and the four European nations bloc EFTA has come into force, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said on Wednesday.

title: Rs 2000 Notes Worth Rs 5,884 Crore Still In Circulation, Says RBI
content: The high-value Rs 2000 notes worth Rs 5,884 crore are still in circulation, according to official data released on Wednesday.

title: Cough syrup linked to deaths of two children in Rajasthan; 22 batches of the drug banned
content: At least 8,200 bottles remain in stock at Jaipur's Sawai Man Singh Hospital, but authorities have instructed that they should not be given to patients.

title: Sonam Wangchuk’s wife writes to President Murmu for his release, seeks intervention on ‘witch-hunt’
content: Gitanjali Angmo, in her letter, asked if it was a sin to fight against reckless and unchecked development activities in an ecologically fragile area of Ladakh

title: CJI Gavai's mother Kamala Gavai says she won't attend RSS centenary  function in Maharashtra
content: “If I had been on the dais (at the October 5 RSS function), I would have put forward the Ambedkarite ideology,” Kamala Gavai wrote

title: Tejasvi Surya to head parliamentary panel on Jan Vishwas Bill, LS speaker reconstitutes committees
content: BJP leader Baijayant Panda was appointed chairman of the select committee to examine the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code Bill, while the chairpersons of almost all the department-related parliamentary panels, including Congress leader Shashi Tharoor, have been re-nominated to their respective positions

title: Ladakh L-G chairs security review meeting, says restrictions to be lifted in a phased manner
content: Kavinder Gupta lauded the relentless efforts of the security forces and the civil administration in restoring normalcy over the past week

title: Karur stampede | Government did its part, TVK failed in its duty: DMK’s Senthilbalaji
content: Pointing to a recent DMK “Mupperum Vizha” in Karur, which drew nearly 2.5 lakh people, Mr. Senthilbalaji contrasted the preparations

title: Touch of Telangana at Bathukamma, Dasara celebrations in Detroit
content: The festivities organised by the Global Telangana Association (GTA) Detroit Chapter witnessed a record-breaking attendance

title: ‘Congress is a party of factions and internal rifts’ says Haryana CM Saini
content: The cooperative societies had lost the trust of farmers during the Congress regime, but our government will work to restore this trust, says Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini

title: Cabinet approves ₹11,440 crore mission to make India self-sufficient in pulses
content: The "Mission for Aatmanirbharta in Pulses", approved by the Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, will be for the period from 2025-26 to 2030-31

title: India, EFTA trade pact comes into force: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal
content: The Union Commerce Minister said the pact will unlock new opportunities for trade, investment and job creation, benefiting people and businesses

title: Any issue can be resolved only through talks: Ladakh L-G Kavinder Gupta to agitating groups
content: Mr. Gupta lashes out at Rahul Gandhi for his remarks on the Ladakh situation, alleging that the Congress leader was trying to “vitiate the atmosphere” in the country

title: Search operation launched after suspicious movement in J&K’s Kathua
content: The search operation was jointly launched by the police and the Border Security Force (BSF) in the area along the Ujh river near the Jhathana village located near the International Border

title: Watch: What happened on September 27, the night of the stampede in Karur? | Reporter’s Diary
content: What began as routine political rally by actor-turned politician Vijay’s TVK in Karur soon spiralled into chaos and at least 41 people died in a stampede. The Hindu’s C. Jaisankar was on the ground that fateful day. This is his first-hand account of how the tragedy unfolded.

title: Mortar shell defused along LoC in J&K’s Rajouri
content: The shell is believed to have landed in the village from across the border during cross-border shelling during Operation Sindoor in May

title: GST collections rise by 9% to ₹1.89 lakh crore in September
content: The GST collections were 9.1% higher than the same month a year ago and over 1.5% higher than the previous month

title: India welcome to collect Asia Cup trophy from me at ACC office in Dubai: Mohsin Naqvi
content: In a post on X, Mr. Naqvi rejected reports claiming that he, at the ACC AGM on Tuesday (September 30), apologised to BCCI officials for his actions at the presentation ceremony

title: Bareilly violence: 2 'outsiders' with criminal history nabbed after gunfight with police
content: District Magistrate Avinash Singh on Wednesday (October 1) said nearly 80 accused have been identified in the case, and arms licences of half a dozen people are being cancelled.

title: PM unveils ₹100 coin, stamp at RSS centenary; first-ever depiction of Bharat Mata on Indian currency
content: In the mission of building a developed India by 2047, the contribution of the Sangh will be crucial, said PM Modi.

title: Dowry cases rise by 14% in 2023; over 6,100 women killed: NCRB
content: Uttar Pradesh again topped the chart with 2,122 deaths, followed by Bihar with 1,143. Dowry was listed as the motive in 833 murder cases across the country in 2023

title: Civic notice to school for 'ban' on religious, cultural symbols
content: The controversy erupted after some parents raised objections over students being prohibited from wearing 'tilak' or 'tikli' (bindi) on their foreheads, bangles, and rakhi or sacred threads.

title: 150 years of national song ‘Vande Mataram’ to be celebrated across India: Union Cabinet
content: According to the ‘India.Gov’ portal, ‘Vande Mataram’ was composed in Sanskrit by Bankimchandra Chatterji.

title: Rajesh Agrawal takes charge as Commerce Secretary
content: Rajesh Agrawal was the chief negotiator for the India-U.S. Bilateral Trade Agreement, Indo-Pacific Economic Forum, India-Australia CECA, and review of the ASEAN FTA

title: Cabinet hikes wheat MSP by ₹160 per quintal to ₹2,585
content: The MSP has been decided based on the recommendations of the Commission for Agricultural Costs and Prices (CACP), says Information and Broadcasting Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

title: Congress did protest Rahul death threat, CPI(M) ministers 'mistaken': LoP Satheesan
content: Satheesan said that the threat by the BJP leader, Printu Mahadevan, was made on a news channel on September 26

title: Centre hikes Dearness Allowance/Dearness Relief by 3%; to benefit 1.18 crore employees, pensioners
content: The DA/DR increase of 3% over the existing rate of 55% of the basic pay/pension to compensate against the price rise is effective July 1, 2025

title: Former Punjab Minister Anil Joshi joins Congress
content: Anil Joshi’s joining came days after he met Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and party general secretary (organisation) K.C. Venugopal in Delhi

title: Ennore building collapse: PMK demands inquiry, seeks compensation for victims
content: The building, under construction at the Ennore Thermal Power Station in North Chennai, collapsed on September 30, claiming the lives of nine migrant workers, all hailing from Assam

title: TVK postpones Vijay’s Saturday rallies in the wake of Karur stampede
content: In a social media update, the party’s official handle pointed out to the Karur tragedy and said “we are in anguish and regret over the loss of 41 of our brethren”

title: No proposal to levy charges on UPI transactions: RBI Governor Malhotra
content: The Governor said the central bank is examining a proposal to allow lenders to remotely lock mobile phones bought on credit in case of default in EMI payments

title: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party submits memorandum to Bihar Governor for Deputy CM's removal
content: A delegation of the fledgling party, headed by national president Uday Singh and State unit chief Manoj Bharti, visited Raj Bhavan late Tuesday evening

title: Police detain Congress MP, SP MLA at house to prevent from visiting Bareilly
content: The two leaders were scheduled to travel to the city by an early morning train to meet some police officers, but were confined to their residences

title: Arunachal Pradesh Congress demands apology from BJP over 'death threat' to Rahul Gandhi
content: "This is not just an irresponsible remark, but a criminal act of intimidation," APCC president Bosiram Siram said

title: How to attract birds, butterflies and other beings? - Experts suggest measures as HYDRAA rejuvenates Hyderabad’s lakes
content: People working towards documenting and restoration of biodiversity, urged authorities undertaking lake rejuvenation to take proactive measures to restore biodiversity

title: India wasted opportunity to give befitting reply to Pakistan after Pahalgam terror attack: Owaisi
content: Asaduddin Owaisi says an atmosphere of war had prevailed as drones launched by Pakistan hovered over the western borders from Gujarat to Kashmir

title: PM Modi's silence on atrocities in Gaza 'total betrayal' of what India has stood for: Congress
content: "Where is the accountability for the genocide that has been carried out in Gaza over the past twenty months?" Jairam Ramesh said

title: Odisha districts on alert as IMD forecasts heavy rain till October 5 owing to low pressure over Bay of Bengal
content: For October 2, it has issued a ‘Red’ warning of above 20-cm rainfall in Puri and Jagstingpur districts, an ‘Orange’ warning (7 cm to 20 cm rain) for 14 districts, and a ‘Yellow’ warning (7 cm to 11 cm rain) for the remaining 14 districts

title: Contractor booked in building collapse incident at Ennore SEZ thermal power project
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister M.K. Stalin expressed grief over the incident; the nine victims hail from Assam

title: Major General G. Srinivas, who oversaw logistics in Operation Sindoor, takes charge as CDM Commandant
content: Before his appointment, Major General Srinivas was entrusted with the planning and execution of operational logistics in the Western Command theatre, including during the recent Operation Sindoor

title: Mid-air scuffle with Uttar Pradesh MLA lands passenger in police custody
content: The incident happened on Air India flight when MLA Rakesh Pratap Singh objected to a passenger, Samad Ali, allegedly using foul language while talking on the phone

title: Police close probe into stone attack on Anil Deshmukh; leader alleges pressure
content: The former Maharashtra Home Minister claimed the police were under pressure and the incident was being given a political colour

title: Zubeen Garg’s manager, Singapore festival organiser arrested from NCR, remanded to 14 days’ police custody
content: The two were flown to Guwahati and taken to the residence of the chief judicial magistrate concerned, as the courts are closed due to the Durga Puja holiday

title: Conflict-hit Manipur logged over 6,200 arson cases in 2023, 45% of India’s total
content: The sharp rise in arson cases in 2023 aligns with the widespread destruction recorded during the ethnic conflict that year in the State

title: Charge sheet filed against rapper Vedan and others for ‘ganja’ consumption
content: The accused have been charged under the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act and they were let off on bail after their arrest

title: RSS general secretary hails “unwavering” public support for the Sangh through its 100-year journey
content: The Sangh consistently sought consensus on matters of Hindu unity, national security, social harmony, democracy, and preservation of culture, says Mr. Hosabale, adding that acceptance grew steadily over time

title: Speculating on ‘Kathipara’
content: ‘The entire area has a lot of streets that have Army connotations — Lashkarkhana (a camp), Asarghana (Afsar Khana or Officer’s Enclave), Butt Road (there was a rifle practice butt here), Magazine Road, North Parade, etc.’

title: When 50 people died in two Sunday stampedes in Chennai
content: The deaths of 50 people in two stampedes, both of which occurred on Sundays, in Chennai, 20 years ago, would illustrate how lessons in crowd management are rarely learned

title: Two police constables arrested for raping young woman in Tiruvannamalai
content: The 19-year-old survivor, who hails from Andhra Pradesh, was picked up by the duo after stopping the truck she was travelling in for checking documents

title: When an industrialist’s saree giveaway at Palani ended in stampede on Gandhi Jayanthi
content: Late at night in 1993 chaos broke out with everyone in the crowd wanting to grab the sarees. In the melee many elderly women fell down leading to a stampede that killed 12 women

title: Punjab seeks special package for flood damages; Centre says it stands shoulder to shoulder with people of Punjab
content: The relief of ₹1,600 crore announced by the Centre is miniscule in the wake of the grave loss suffered by Punjab, says CM Mann

title: Commission for quacks: How private hospitals in Telangana profit from unqualified practitioners
content: The practice of unqualified medical practitioners operating so-called ‘first aid centres’ has been rampant in Telangana for decades.

title: ED searches Reliance Infrastructure premises on charges of FEMA violation
content: In a statement Reliance Infrastructure clarified that the survey was relating to a matter dating back 15 years.

title: RSS should continue to focus on nation-building for next 100 years, says former Congress MP Karan Singh
content: Though Mr. Singh’s stance is at odds with the Congress’s official position on the RSS, the party has not issued any statement or clarification

title: Over 60 lakh hectares of farms hit by rains, have sought relief from Centre, says CM Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra CM seeks relief package for flood-affected farmland, rejects “wet drought” term, promises aid before Deepavali

title: Karur stampede: What triggered the chaos
content: The stampede at an overcrowded roadshow held by Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam founder and actor Vijay occurred due to poor planning and leadership

title: Uttarakhand police forms SIT to probe journalist Rajiv Pratap’s death
content: The journalist's family has alleged that he had been receiving threats following some of his news reports; journalists' organisations have also demanded a thorough probe into the circumstances of his death.

title: Wangchuk served NSA detention order: Ladakh administration
content: It accused the climate activist of suggesting “self-immolation” to people of Ladakh on “multiple occasions” on “lines of protests in Tibet”

title: Telangana logged 10,580 suicides in 2023, says NCRB
content: Family problems were cited as the predominant trigger for suicides in Telangana, claiming 4,680 lives, or 44.2% of the State’s total cases

title: Civil society groups, activists demand Wangchuk’s release
content: Addressing a press conference, Gitanjali Angmo, Mr. Wangchuk’s wife, said she had not been able to contact her husband, nor had the police provided her a copy of the NSA order yet.

title: Tamil Nadu seeks review of Supreme Court judgment directing teachers to qualify for TET or quit service
content: If the directions are implemented, the entire school system faces the imminent prospect of collapse, with mass disqualification of teachers and denial of classroom instruction to millions of children. This creates a direct conflict with Article 21A of the Constitution, which guarantees the fundamental right to education, Tamil Nadu argues in Supreme Court

title: Lorry topples on Chennai-Bengaluru Highway in Ambur
content: Police said the lorry was proceeding towards Koyambedu Wholesale market in Chennai from Bengaluru to deliver a consignment of onions when the driver suddenly lost control of the vehicle.

title: Maharashtra, Karnataka report most number of farmer suicides
content: Removing import restrictions, succumbing to ‘tariff terrorism’ will worsen the situation, warns Kisan Sabha

title: Bihar had just five Passport and Foreigners Act cases in 2023: NCRB report
content: Illegal migration and infiltration have been raised as key issues ahead of the Bihar polls; according to NCRB data, in 2023, most of the cases pertaining to laws governing foreigners were registered in Bengal, followed by Tripura, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu and Punjab

title: BJP moves to consolidate votes in Bihar, to pull out Madhya Pradesh playbook
content: Bhojpuri singer Pawan Singh, whose independent candidacy led to NDA’s defeat in Karakat in 2024 Lok Sabha elections, has been pulled back into the party fold. The party is also planning to field many senior leaders, including Union Ministers, in the Assembly polls as it did in Madhya Pradesh

title: U.P. PGT exam postponed again; aspirants, Opposition slam government’s repeated delays
content: Students allege that this is the fifth time the examination, whose notification was released in April 2022, has been postponed, citing unavoidable reasons

title: Source: Collier tore ankle ligaments on collision
content: Lynx star Napheesa Collier suffered a Grade 2 tear of three ligaments in her ankle and a muscle in her shin during the collision with Mercury forward Alyssa Thomas, a source told ESPN.

title: Sources: Big Ten mulling $2B private capital deal
content: The Big Ten is in talks about a private capital deal, which includes a 10-year grant of rights extension through '46, that would infuse at least $2 billion into the league and its schools, sources told ESPN.

title: A.J. Brown says post wasn't about Eagles, Hurts
content: Eagles receiver A.J. Brown took responsibility Wednesday for letting his "frustrations boil over" Sunday and stated that his post on social media wasn't directed at anyone inside the building, including quarterback Jalen Hurts.

title: Many top options at PG, C in points league draft tiers

title: What went wrong, what needs to happen next for U.S.
